FW (100%)/ 433.59 M3      BALLAST WATER/ 30886.46 M3
Constants: about 550MT (excl. freshwater)
Speed/Consumption:
Ballast: about 12 kts on about IFO 22 MT (380CST) +MD/GO 0.1 MT at sea
Laden: about 11.5 kts on about IFO 24 MT (380CST) +MD/GO 0.1 MT at sea
Port idle: about 3.5 IFO + 0.1 MD/GO (MT/24hours)
Port working: about 5.5 IFO + 0.1 MD/GO (MT/24hours)
ADDITIONAL 1 MT IFO PER DAY FOR BOILER IN COLD WEATHER.
BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING EXCHANGE AND HOLDS CLEANING WHILE AT SEA OR PORT THE TOTAL CONSUMPTION OF THE VESSEL WILL BE INCREASED BY ABT 4 MT
ALL FIGURES STATED FOR SPEED AND CONSUMPTION ARE "ABOUT" ALWAYS UPWARDS IN EFFECT FOR BUNKERS AND CLEAN UNDER WATER HULL, ABOUT TO MEAN -0.5 KNOTS AND +5% ON CONSUMPTION. FOR THE PURPOSE OF CALCULATING VESSEL'S PERFORMANCE UNDER THIS CHARTER PARTY IT IS AGREED THAT ALL DAYS AND TIME WHERE THE WEATHER EXCEEDS BFF 4 AND DSS3, ADVERSE CURRENT, NEGATIVE INLUENCE OF SWELL AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE AND SWELL HEIGHT EXCEEDING 1.25M ARE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED FROM PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT ANDCALCULATIONS. AN ADMISSIBLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. POSITIVE CURRENTS NOT TO BE DEBITED FROM VESSEL'S SPEED IN SPEED/CONSUMPTION CALCULATIONS. DEFICIENCY IN SPEED, IF ANY, CAN BE OFFSET BY THE SAVING OF IFO AND/OR MGO AND VICE VERSA.
HOWEVER, WHILST MANOUEVRING IN/OUT OF PORTS, RIVERS, CANALS, NARROW WATERS, SAILING IN PIRACY AREAS, HEAVY TRAFFIC, FOGS, STEAMING/STAYING IN ECA AREAS/PORTS ETC ABOVE SPEED & CONS WARRANTY IS NOT APPLICABLE, VESSEL MAY BURN LSMGO IN THE ENGINE
BUNKER SPECS:
FUEL OIL 380 CST SPECS: ISO 8217 2010 RMG 380 (SULPHUR CONTENT < 0.5%)
DIESEL OILS SPECS: ISO-8217 2010 DMA/B (SULPHUR CONTENT < 0.1%)
EMISSION CONTROL RESTRICTION BY INTERNATIONAL, NATIONAL, LOCAL AUTHORITIES TO BE MAINTAINED
NO OPL BUNKERING
